gameTicTacToe.title: Tic Tac Toe
gameTicTacToe.instructions:
The goal of tic-tac-toe is to be the first player to get three in a row on a 3-by-3 grid.
1. Play occurs on a 3 by 3 grid of 9 empty squares.
2. Two players alternate marking empty squares, the first player marking Xs and the second player marking Os.
3. If one player places three of the same marks in a row, that player wins.
 4. If the spaces are all filled and there is no winner, the game ends in a draw.

incontinence.details: Detailed instructions and pictures about pelvic floor exercises

menu.title: Psychology & Wellbeing
menu.header:
Feeling overwhelmed by the Cancer? 

               Expressive Writing can Help
menu.text1:
Expressive writing is easy. Just sit down and write about something that is bothering you. It’s simple and there is no right or wrong way to do it.

This application urges you to try out expressive writing to help you deal with the Cancer outbreak. By writing about your thoughts and feelings for as little as 5-10 minutes, you may change the ways you are thinking, feeling, and even sleeping.
menu.subheader2: What are the Benefits of Expressive Writing?
menu.text2: Expressive writing has been around for over 30 years. Hundreds of experiments have demonstrated its effectiveness in improving people’s mental and physical health. By putting emotional upheavals into words, we start to understand them better. Once we have a better handle on our problems, we can move forward and get on with life.

expressiveWriting.details: To start, plan to spend at least 5-10 minutes (or longer, if you want) writing about your experience with cancer. The basic instructions are for you to write about your deepest thoughts and feelings about your issue without worrying about spelling, grammar, or sentence structure. Just write.

formPage.header: EXPRESSIVE WRITING: Your thoughts and feelings about cancer
formPage.text:
In the box below, express your thoughts and feelings about cancer in as much detail as you can. Try to let go and just write for at least 5-10 minutes (or longer if you want). You might write about how the outbreak is affecting you and the people around you. Or how are you dealing with feelings such as anxiety or isolation? Really try to address those issues most important for you. Please write continuously for the entire time, and don’t worry too much about spelling or punctuation errors.

All information will be kept anonymous and confidential.
formPage.textAlert: You have to write something in order for us to analyze.

resultPage.text: For this writing exercise, you were asked to write 5-10 minutes about your deepest thoughts and feelings about Cancer . Before looking at your feedback, it’s important that you know that you are the real judge of your writing. Did you find it helpful? Are you thinking about the topic in a different way than when you started?
